intro: Rourea brachyandra, commonly known as the narrow-leaved rourea, is a species of flowering plant native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its dense, compact growth habit and glossy, dark green leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color, clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique appearance and restricted distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
